perturbation.original_text: Client will be promoted as the preferred and dominant reseller of Vitamins in the Health Channel on the WebCrawler Site during the term of this Agreement. As such, Excite may not display banner advertising and/or promotional placements for any of Client's Competitors that are, in the aggregate, of equal or greater prominence and exposure than the aggregate of Client's links, advertising banners and promotional placements on the pages of the Health Channel on the WebCrawler Site during the term of this Agreement. For purposes of this Agreement, Client's Competitors means those merchants identified in Exhibit D attached hereto. Client may update
perturbation.changed_text: Client will be promoted as the preferred reseller of Vitamins in the Health Channel on the WebCrawler Site during the term of this Agreement. As such, Excite may not display banner advertising and/or promotional placements for any of Client's Other Vitamin Sellers that are, in the aggregate, of equal or greater prominence and exposure than the aggregate of Client's links, advertising banners and promotional placements on the pages of the Health Channel on the WebCrawler Site during the term of this Agreement. For purposes of this Agreement, Client's Other Vitamin Sellers means those merchants identified in Exhibit D attached hereto. Client may update
perturbation.explanation: Changing the term 'Competitors' to 'Other Vitamin Sellers' introduces ambiguity. The term 'competitors' has a defined business meaning, while 'Other Vitamin Sellers' is vague, making enforcement of exclusivity clauses more difficult. This introduces a perturbation by creating uncertainty about who is considered a competitor and what constitutes a violation of the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Ambiguity in Contractual Terms

perturbation.original_text: Client will be promoted as the preferred and dominant reseller of Vitamins in the Shopping Channel on the WebCrawler Site during the term of this Agreement. As such, Excite may not display banner advertising and/or promotional placements for any of Client's Competitors that are, in the aggregate, of equal or greater prominence and exposure than the aggregate of Client's links, advertising banners and promotional placements on the pages of the Shopping Channel or the WebCrawler Site.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, Excite may display links to Excite's own products and services anywhere in the Excite Network, and may display links to Client's Competitors in results pages of search services in response to user queries, in general directories of Web sites, in classified advertising listings and in results in the "Jango" shopping search service throughout the Excite Network.
perturbation.changed_text: Client will be promoted as the preferred reseller of Vitamins in the Shopping Channel on the WebCrawler Site during the term of this Agreement. As such, Excite may not display banner advertising and/or promotional placements for any of Client's Other Vitamin Sellers that are, in the aggregate, of equal or greater prominence and exposure than the aggregate of Client's links, advertising banners and promotional placements on the pages of the Shopping Channel or the WebCrawler Site.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, Excite may display links to Excite's own products and services anywhere in the Excite Network, and may display links to Client's Other Vitamin Sellers in results pages of search services in response to user queries, in general directories of Web sites, in classified advertising listings and in results in the "Jango" shopping search service throughout the Excite Network.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Competitors' to 'Other Vitamin Sellers' again, the contract's clarity regarding exclusivity is undermined. A 'competitor' typically implies direct rivalry, while 'Other Vitamin Sellers' could include businesses that sell vitamins as a secondary offering. This ambiguity allows Excite more leeway in featuring other vitamin sellers, potentially diminishing the value of Client's preferred status.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Ambiguity in Contractual Terms

perturbation.original_text: Client will not use User Data to specifically target any Excite and/or WebCrawler users, as distinct from all users of the Client Site, for solicitations (except as specifically provided in this Agreement), either individually or in the aggregate, during the term of this Agreement and for a period of twelve (12) months following the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Client will not use User Data to specifically contact any Excite and/or WebCrawler users, as distinct from all users of the Client Site, for solicitations (except as specifically provided in this Agreement), either individually or in the aggregate, during the term of this Agreement and for a period of twelve (12) months following the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the word 'target' to 'contact' creates a contradiction to user data laws. While targeting is related to the use of data for advertisement purposes, 'contact' is broader. This undermines user data protection by suggesting a broader permission than legally allowed, potentially exposing user information without clear constraints.
